data.title: How To Trade SPY, QQQ, AAPL, MSFT, NVDA, GOOGL, META, TSLA Using Technical Analysis
data.description:
Good Morning Traders!

Today's economic calendar closes out the week with the highly anticipated January PPI report at 8:30AM ET, including Final Demand, Core PPI, and PPI Ex Food, Energy, and Trade. This release will be closely monitored for signs of upstream inflation pressures that could influence future Fed policy expectations and bond yields. At 9:45AM ET, the MNI Chicago PMI provides insight into regional manufacturing conditions. 

At 10:00AM ET, Construction Spending data is released, followed by the Kansas City Fed Services Activity report at 11:00AM ET. Later in the afternoon at 3:00PM ET, Agricultural Prices Paid and Received round out the data slate. With inflation data driving early positioning and lighter releases into the afternoon, expect volatility around 8:30AM ET and potential consolidation into the weekend.

Now we will discuss SPY, QQQ, AAPL, MSFT, NVDA, GOOGL, META, and TSLA.

SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY)
SPY is currently trading around 685.75 as markets prepare for the 8:30AM ET PPI release, which will be closely watched following recent inflation volatility. If buyers defend this level on a favorable inflation read, a move toward 688.00 may develop, followed by 690.25 if upside momentum builds into the mid morning session. Sustained strength above 692.00 would indicate expanding participation and could open the door toward 695.00 into the close. 

If SPY loses 685.75 with conviction, sellers may press into 683.50. A breakdown there could expose 681.25, and continued downside pressure may test 678.75. Inflation data tends to trigger sharp bond market reactions, so expect volatility around the 8:30AM window.

Invesco QQQ Trust Series 1 (QQQ)

QQQ is currently trading around 606.25 and remains sensitive to rate driven moves following PPI. Holding above this pivot may allow a rotation into 608.75, followed by 611.50 if growth names regain traction. A break above 613.75 would reflect stronger upside momentum and potential continuation into the upper range. 

If 606.25 fails to hold, sellers may guide price into 603.50. A sustained breakdown could bring 600.75 into focus, and deeper weakness may target 597.25. Tech may exaggerate any yield reaction to inflation data.

Apple Inc. (AAPL)

AAPL is currently trading around 272.25 and attempting to build higher structure after recent consolidation. If buyers defend this zone, a move toward 274.75 may develop, followed by 277.00 if broader tech firms. Sustained strength above 279.50 would signal improving institutional demand. 

If 272.25 breaks lower, sellers may test 269.90. A breakdown there could expose 267.50, and continued weakness may bring 264.75 into view. Watch Apple's relative strength for signs of mega cap resilience.

Microsoft Corp. (MSFT)

MSFT is currently trading around 397.50 and remains just below the key 400 level. If buyers reclaim 400.00 with strength, price may rotate toward 402.75, followed by 405.50 if momentum builds. A sustained push above 408.00 would indicate structural improvement in large cap tech. 

If 397.50 fails to hold, sellers may press into 394.75. Continued weakness could extend into 392.00, and deeper downside may test 389.25. Microsoft's reaction to bond yields will likely influence QQQ sentiment.

NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA)

NVDA is currently trading around 184.25 and remains volatile following earnings. If buyers defend this pivot, a move toward 187.75 may develop, followed by 190.50 if upside momentum returns. Sustained trade above 193.25 would reflect renewed confidence in the semiconductor space. 

If 184.25 breaks lower, sellers may test 181.75 quickly. A breakdown there could expose 178.50, and continued weakness may target 175.75. NVDA's direction will likely set the tone for broader tech.

Alphabet Inc Class A (GOOGL)

GOOGL is currently trading around 306.25 and attempting to stabilize above recent consolidation. If buyers defend this zone, a move toward 308.75 may unfold, followed by 311.50 if communication services strengthen. A break above 314.00 would signal renewed upside momentum. 

If 306.25 fails, sellers may press into 303.75. A sustained breakdown could expose 301.25, and deeper weakness may target 298.50. Losing the 300 region would dampen enthusiasm in large cap growth.

Meta Platforms Inc (META)

META is currently trading around 651.75 and maintaining relative stability. If buyers step in, price may rotate toward 655.50, followed by 659.25 if upside momentum expands. Sustained strength above 662.00 would indicate continued leadership within growth names. 

If 651.75 breaks down, sellers may guide price into 647.50. A deeper pullback could test 643.75, and continued weakness may bring 639.50 into focus. Relative performance here will provide clues about broader risk appetite.

Tesla Inc. (TSLA)

TSLA is currently trading around 406.50 and remains reactive to macro tone. If buyers defend this pivot, a push toward 410.25 may develop, followed by 414.00 if momentum builds. A breakout above 418.50 would signal stronger speculative participation. 

If 406.50 fails to hold, sellers may test 402.75. Continued downside pressure could extend into 399.25, and deeper weakness may bring 395.50 into view. Tesla often amplifies broader market swings.

Final Word: 

Trade with discipline, manage risk carefully, happy Friday, and have a great weekend.

Benzinga Disclaimer: This article is from an unpaid external contributor. It does not represent Benzinga’s reporting and has not been edited for content or accuracy.

data.title: 'This Is Not Rocket Science'—After Figuring Out Startups Aren't Led By 'Wizards,' She Built A Landline Phone Business That Made $789K In 6 Months
data.description:
When her smartphone started to feel more compelling than real life, for entrepreneur Cat Goetze, that was a wake-up call.

“I decided to create the landline phone because I realized one day that the colors on my phone were more beautiful than the colors in real life,” she told CNBC recently. “And that was a major problem for me.”

From Zero Traction To $120,000 In Three Days

Don't Miss:

  • The ‘ChatGPT of Marketing' Just Opened a $0.85/Share Round — 10,000+ Investors Are Already In
  • This Energy Storage Company Already Has $185M in Contracts—Shares Are Still Available

She wasn't willing to do that. With her background studying science, technology and society at Stanford University and experience working in startups, she thought she could build something herself.

“These people aren’t wizards,” she told CNBC. “This is not rocket science. I think if they can do it, I can do it, too.” 

She built a prototype of a Bluetooth-compatible landline phone that connects to a smartphone. When a call comes in, whether it's a regular call, FaceTime or WhatsApp, the physical phone rings. You can pick up the handset to answer and hang up by placing it down. If you dial star, it activates Siri so you can say “call mom” instead of memorizing numbers.

Goetze posted her prototype on TikTok in 2023, but it got no traction as her brand, CatGPT, wasn't yet established online.

She didn't post about it again until last July, after building a strong following that focused on branded content and partnerships. This time, the response was immediate. Her company, Physical Phones, passed $120,000 in sales in its first three days.

Last year alone, the business brought in about $789,000 in six months, and to date, it has sold more than 7,500 phones.

Trending: Disney Was Built on Character IP — This Pre-IPO Company Is Using the Same Playbook

Bootstrapped, Pre-Ordered And Profitable

Today, Physical Phones sells three styles priced between $90 and $110, including rotary models and a wall-mounted version. The entire first production run was funded through pre-orders.

“We took out no loans. We took no investment,” Goetze told CNBC.

The pre-order money covered manufacturing, warehousing, shipping and early hiring. To meet shipping deadlines, the company air-freighted inventory from Asia, which took a hit on profit margins but ensured customers received their phones on time.

Manufacturing was one of the hardest parts. The back-and-forth with factories was detailed and draining. “Every single detail gets poured over for a hardware product,” she said.

She doesn’t take a salary from Physical Phones. Instead, she supports herself through her media business. The phone company now has a CEO who handles day-to-day operations, while she focuses on product vision and storytelling.

Her broader approach reflects a growing desire for simpler, more tangible products in a digital world. 

Many are exploring new ways to build income outside traditional jobs, just like Goetze did. Arrived allows you to invest in shares of rental properties for as little as $100, providing the potential for monthly rental income and long-term appreciation without the hassles of being a landlord.

Goetze is now weighing whether to continue limited product drops or move to a more traditional always-in-stock model. She is also launching CAT Labs, a studio aimed at building more products in the future.

Image: Shutterstock

data.title: Paramount Skydance Emerges As Underpriced Winner For WBD After Netflix Folds: Value Score Rises
data.description:
Paramount Skydance Corp. (NASDAQ:PSKY) has seen its Benzinga Edge value score climb to the 88.93th percentile, signaling the stock is increasingly underpriced even as it secures its position as the winning bidder for Warner Bros. Discovery (NASDAQ:WBD).

Rising Value Amidst Price Headwinds

However, the rising value rank to the 88.93th percentile indicates that the stock is increasingly attractive relative to its fundamental assets and earnings.

This high percentile ranking suggests that while market sentiment is currently bearish, the company's relative worth is significantly higher than its current market price.

While the fundamental value is high, technical indicators remain cautious for PSKY. Benzinga Edge’s Stock Rankings‘ price trend analysis currently shows negative signals across short, medium, and long-term horizons.

The Winning ‘Superior Proposal’

The takeover battle reached a decisive turning point on Thursday when Netflix co-CEOs Ted Sarandos and Greg Peters announced they would not match the higher price offered by Paramount Skydance.

The WBD board had previously labeled the PSKY bid—which includes a $31 per share cash price and a $7 billion regulatory termination fee—as a “Company Superior Proposal”. Netflix shares climbed nearly 10% on the news as the company prioritized “financial discipline” over a costly bidding war.

PSKY Remains Negative In 2026

Despite securing the deal, PSKY’s market performance remains under pressure, with the stock down 15.17% year-to-date and 24.51% in the last six months.

On Thursday, the stock closed 10.04% higher at $11.18 apiece, and it was up 8.41% in premarket on Friday.

Disclaimer: This content was partially produced with the help of AI tools and was reviewed and published by Benzinga editors.

Image via Shutterstock

data.title: Duolingo Analysts Slash Their Forecasts Following Q4 Results
data.description:
Duolingo Inc (NASDAQ:DUOL) on Thursday reported upbeat fourth-quarter sales but issued sales guidance below estimates.

Duolingo posted quarterly sales of $282.868 million, beating market estimates of $275.925 million.

Duolingo said it sees FY2026 sales of $1.197 billion to $1.221 billion, versus expectations of $1.264 billion.

“At the same time, advances in AI are fundamentally reshaping how people learn, and we believe this is a pivotal moment for our company. In 2026, we are deliberately prioritizing user growth and teaching better. We’ll focus on improving the free learner experience to grow word of mouth and feed our next user growth engines like chess, math and music, even though that moderates near-term financial growth. We believe this strategy positions Duolingo to reach 100 million daily active users in the medium-term and build a significantly larger, more durable business in the long-term.”

Duolingo shares fell 25.6% to $87.45 in pre-market trading.

These analysts made changes to their price targets on Duolingo following earnings announcement.
